biography.value: Clinging to the wall of a water-filled chamber inside The Hidden Shrine of Tamoachan is Tecuziztecatl, also known as the Lord of Snails. This giant slug is not only intelligent, it’s capable of speech. If faced with enemies that are too much of a threat for it, the slug might offer to provide assistance, or it might submerge itself to avoid further harm.

description.value:
Tecuziztecatl makes two pseudopod attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Tecuziztecatl exhales &Reference[acid]{acid} in a 30-foot &Reference[line]{line} that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that &Reference[line]{line} must make a [[/save dex 13 format=long]], taking [[/damage 4d8 type=acid average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Amphibious. Tecuziztecatl can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Glowing. Tecuziztecatl sheds dim light within 20 feet of itself.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Flexible. Tecuziztecatl can enter a space large enough for a Medium creature without squeezing.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Spider Climb. Tecuziztecatl can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
